Crimes.Legal_Issue: Reasonableness of PRRA Officer's assessment of state protection in Honduras
Crimes.Procedural_Stage: Pre-removal risk assessment (PRRA) and judicial review
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Officer failed to consider evidence of police ineffectiveness and corruption in Honduras
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to demonstrate risk upon return
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Applicant's testimony supported by country condition evidence
Crimes.Legal_Rule: State protection must be operationally effective, not merely existent
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Failure to assess actual functionality of state protection mechanisms
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of gang violence and lack of state protection in Honduras
Crimes.Outcome_on_Merits: Not reached due to procedural unreasonableness
Crimes.Review_Standard: Reasonableness standard applied by Federal Court
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Assessment found unfair due to inadequate reasoning
Crimes.Legal_Framework: International refugee law and domestic immigration legislation
Crimes.Court_Result: Decision quashed and referred back for reconsideration by a different officer
Crimes.Legal_Rule_Source: Jurisprudence on state protection under IRPA and UNHCR guidelines
Crimes.Defendant_Response: No direct response from state; represented by immigration authorities
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Quashing of PRRA decision and referral for re-determination
Crimes.Resolution_Mechanism: Judicial review under subsection 72(1) of IRPA
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Inadmissible person with prior irregular entry
Legal_Provision_Cited: Section 97(1) IRPA - Risk to life, cruel and unusual treatment or punishment
Crimes.Applicable_Process: PRRA process and subsequent judicial review
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Operational effectiveness of state protection is key to assessing risk
